questions.question_text:
A meeting agenda included the following items:

• Review the goals of the project.
• Review the progress of the project.
• Discuss if the project is ready to move forward.

Which of the following BEST describes this type of meeting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"Discuss if the project is ready to move forward."
Gate review.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D. Gate review.

A gate review is a meeting that is held to assess the progress of a project and to decide whether the project should proceed to the next stage. The meeting agenda typically includes the items listed above, as well as a discussion of any risks or challenges that the project is facing.

Selected Answer: D
Gate review is the way to go on this one

Selected Answer: D
The benefits of Gate review:
-Still aligned to organizational strategy
-On track to deliver the forecasted benefits
-Still required by the business
-Still due to complete with the allocated funding
-Following good governance processes with adequate oversight.

questions.question_text: A new project team started work three months ago. The team members are increasing their work productivity and are comfortable asking for help with tasks. Which of the following describes the current stage of the project team?

comments.content: Dont you love it when the questions are this simple?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The question is the textbook definition of norm.

Selected Answer: D
• Norming: The team starts working together, and team members adjust
their work to support the team as a whole. During this phase, team
members start to trust each other.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST example of a breach of physical security?

choices.B: Printers that do not request user authentication
choices.C: Developers having full access to both development and production environments
choices.D: Project documentation that is only kept on a removable device
choices.A: System user IDs being used by multiple individuals

discussion.content:
I think look at key words here under for data security breach.
A) Deals with system ID used by multiple people. Could be a compromised credential or legitimate use for developers to update project status. Not enough detail given.
B) This one raise a flag where if data is printed with no way to prevent PII or trade secret being overlooked by malicious person, this is understandable to be chosen.
D) Data be stored on removable, a lot of machine requires encryption for removable devices based on their IT policy. It didn't say unencrypted or encrypted so it hard to tell where the selection is going with this one.

I would believe its B on this one because it thrown out with user authentication. I think its a wording game for this.

Selected Answer: D
No doubt about it, D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
I’m going D as well

Selected Answer: D
CompTIA Project + PK0-005 Cert Guide 2nd Edition
Physical Security: Considerations for securing mobile devices,
removable media, and facility access

Selected Answer: D
Storing project documentation solely on a removable device represents a breach of physical security. Physical security refers to the protection of physical assets, including sensitive information, from unauthorized access, theft, or damage.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a typical characteristic of Scrum?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Here is a lil quote from the textbook: "Scrum is a form of agile project management. Scrum project teams consist of crossfunctional team members from various areas of the organization and are self-organized and self-directed. Scrum emphasizes daily communication and the flexible reassessment of plans, which are carried out in short, iterative phases of work called sprints."

Selected Answer: C
C - In Scrum, one of the typical characteristics is a self-organized team. Scrum encourages teams to manage their own work, make decisions, and collaborate effectively, which contributes to greater autonomy and ownership.

Selected Answer: A
These systems are used to track documents and records and often include
version automation, document check-in/checkout, and archival notification

questions.question_text: In the kickoff meeting, a project manager announced the project will use a tool to store documents, artifacts, and any other data relevant to the project. The tool will perform version control, maintain retention data, and archive destruction or historical information. Which of the following is being described?
